intro: Hieracium × bifurcum subsp. thayense, commonly known as the Thayen's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It is distinguished by its finely divided leaves and the presence of two distinct flowering branches, which give it its subspecies name. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
